note.p: Career: Apprenticed to a cooper; worked as a cooper (until age 20); taught himself mathematics; master of a small school, Bishop's Tawton; Assistant, Royal Observatory, Greenwich under Nevil Maskelyne (1773-1776); took Holy Orders; Curate of Constantine, Cornwall (1779-1783); Curate, Greens Norton, Northamptonshire (1783-1790); Vicar of Potterspury, Northamptonshire (1790-1827); founded a school (now named after him), Potterspury (1817)
References: M Croarken, 'Astronomical labourers: Maskelyne's assistants at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich, 1765 - 1811' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 285 - 298
